requirements:
Create a lunch and dinner plan for me for monday.
Each meal should take max 20 mins to create.
I like spicy asian food, like noodles and curry, korean, indian, chinese are all good.
I go to the gym a lot so I need lots of vegetables and very high protein (40+grams per meal).
meals:
Lunch: Spicy Korean Bibimbap
Ingredients: 
- 200g cooked brown rice
- 200g tofu
- 150g spinach
- 100g shredded carrots
- 100g bean sprouts
- 1 egg
- 2 tablespoons gochujang (Korean hot pepper paste)
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- Salt and pepper to taste
Cooking Instructions: 
1. Cut tofu into small cubes and roast them in a pan with a little oil until browned. 
2. Saute each vegetable separately in a pan with a sprinkle of salt. 
3. To make the spicy sauce, combine gochujang, sesame oil, and a pinch of salt and pepper. 
4. Fry an egg. 
5. Arrange the vegetables and tofu over the cooked rice. 
6. Top with the fried egg and a spoonful of the spicy sauce.

Dinner: Quick Thai Green Chicken Curry
Ingredients: 
- 250g chicken breast
- 150g Green Thai curry paste
- 400ml coconut milk
- 100g sliced bell peppers
- 150g broccoli
- 50g sliced carrots
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
Cooking Instructions: 
1. Cut chicken breast into cubes and cook until browned. 
2. Add the Thai green curry paste and stir well. 
3. Add coconut milk and bring to a simmer.  
4. Add bell peppers, broccoli and carrots and cook until tender. 
5. Stir in the soy sauce. 
6. Divide the curry between plates and serve.
